20101229181158.000|20101229181200.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  T.J., we can call it 
20101229181200.000|20101229181203.000|TR0|finger reading.  What you can do, and this 
20101229181203.000|20101229181205.000|TR0|is for men and women - just, kind of, a 
20101229181205.000|20101229181208.000|TR0|fun little party trick.  Take a look at 
20101229181208.000|20101229181210.000|TR0|your hand and you'll notice your index and 
20101229181210.000|20101229181213.000|TR0|your ring finger, on either side of your 
20101229181213.000|20101229181215.000|TR0|middle finger, are probably different 
20101229181215.000|20101229181218.000|TR0|lengths.
20101229181218.000|20101229181220.000|TR0|
20101229181220.000|20101229181222.000|TR0|Now, what's interesting is that for some 
20101229181222.000|20101229181225.000|TR0|people the ring finger is longer, for some 
20101229181225.000|20101229181227.000|TR0|people the index finger is longer, and for 
20101229181227.000|20101229181230.000|TR0|some people they are about the same 
20101229181230.000|20101229181232.000|TR0|length.  These British researchers took a 
20101229181232.000|20101229181235.000|TR0|look at finger length and tried to see if 
20101229181235.000|20101229181237.000|TR0|they could make any connection to prostate 
20101229181237.000|20101229181240.000|TR0|cancer risk.  And I'll get to why they did 
20101229181240.000|20101229181242.000|TR0|that, in a moment.

20101229181245.000|20101229181247.000|TR0|But what they found is that men that had 
20101229181247.000|20101229181250.000|TR0|longer ring fingers were more likely to 
20101229181250.000|20101229181252.000|TR0|have prostate cancer.  And men - 
20101229181252.000|20101229181255.000|TR0|conversely, men who had longer index 
20101229181255.000|20101229181257.000|TR0|fingers were 33 percent less likely to 
20101229181257.000|20101229181300.000|TR0|have prostate cancer.  And there have been 
20101229181300.000|20101229181302.000|TR0|similar findings, also, in a Korean study

20101229182133.000|20101229182135.000|TR0|unfortunately, was two weeks after Katrina 
20101229182135.000|20101229182138.000|TR0|hit New Orleans and, therefore, it got a 
20101229182138.000|20101229182140.000|TR0|lot more attention than it probably should 
20101229182140.000|20101229182143.000|TR0|have. And what we showed was that there 
20101229182143.000|20101229182145.000|TR0|had been an increase of intensity during 
20101229182145.000|20101229182147.000|TR0|the 30 years of warming sea surface 
20101229182147.000|20101229182150.000|TR0|temperatures, which had been attributable 
20101229182150.000|20101229182152.000|TR0|to global warming.
20101229182152.000|20101229182155.000|TR0|
20101229182155.000|20101229182157.000|TR0|What we don't know, of course, is what

20101229185502.000|20101229185505.000|TR0|contamination in Michigan and Canada.  So
